alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 12 at 1:20PM MST until February 15 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TUESDAY TO 6 AM MST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Expect scattered snow showers through the day Monday. Then, a much more serious storm, containing moderate to heavy snow, strong winds and sharply colder temperatures, arrives Tuesday morning, lasting through Tuesday night. Snow totals of 6 to 10 inches are expected at higher elevations, with 2 to 4 inches between 5000 and 6000 feet. * WHERE...Areas above 5000 feet near Grand Canyon, Jacob Lake, North Rim, Prescott, Prescott Valley, Seligman and Valle. * WHEN...From 6 AM Tuesday to 6 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Snow forecast from 6 AM Tuesday to 6 AM Wednesday: Grand Canyon 6 to 10 inches Jacob Lake 5 to 9 inches North Rim 8 to 12 inches Prescott 2 to 4 inches Prescott Valley 1 to 3 inches Seligman 2 to 4 inches Valle 4 to 8 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
